org.openlcb

Interface Connection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConnection, AbstractNodeCache, BitProducerConsumer, BlueGoldEngine, BlueGoldExtendedEngine, DatagramMeteringBuffer, DatagramReceiver, DatagramService, DatagramTransmitter, DccProxyCache, EventFilterGateway, Gateway, LoaderClient, MessageDecoder, MimicNodeStore, MimicNodeStore.NodeMemo, Node, SingleConsumer, SingleConsumerNode, SingleLinkNode, SingleProducer, SingleProducerNode, StreamReceiver, StreamTransmitter, TractionThrottle, TrainNodeCache, VerifyNodeIdHandler

    public interface Connection
    Interface for receiving OpenLCB messages.

    Generally, nodes send messages by delivering them to Connections.

    Author:
    Bob Jacobsen Copyright 2009

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Connection.ConnectionListener
      Internal listener class definition

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void put(Message msg, Connection sender)
      Put a message to this connection.
      void registerStartNotification(Connection.ConnectionListener c)
      Register to be informed when this connection is ready to accept messages.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(Message msg,
         Connection sender)
        Put a message to this connection.
        Parameters:
        sender - Node that is sending the message, used for tracking, logging, etc. (This models a two-ended connection to whatever communications link is used)

      • registerStartNotification

        void registerStartNotification(Connection.ConnectionListener c)
        Register to be informed when this connection is ready to accept messages. Unless you know via some other mechanism that the connection is ready to go, you must register a listener and get the call-back before sending messages through the connection.
